title: Quantum Physics & Quantum Financial Trading Books

books.title: Quantum Finance: Path Integrals and Hamiltonians for Options and Interest Rates
books.author: Belal E. Baaquie
books.summary: The foundational text connecting quantum mechanics to financial derivatives pricing. Uses Feynman path integral formulation to derive option pricing equations, showing exact mathematical mapping between quantum propagators and Black-Scholes equation.
key_insights: Black-Scholes equation is mathematically equivalent to the Schrödinger equation for a free particle
Option price can be computed as a path integral over all possible price trajectories
Hamiltonian formulation provides new analytical tools for derivative pricing
Interest rate models can be expressed using quantum field theory techniques
Path integrals naturally handle path-dependent options (Asian, barrier)

formulas.name: Option Price as Path Integral
formulas.expression: C(S,t) = ∫ D[S(τ)] exp(-∫ L(S,Ṡ) dτ) × Payoff[S(T)]
formulas.explanation: Option price is the integral over all possible price paths weighted by the Lagrangian action.

formulas.name: Financial Schrödinger Equation
formulas.explanation: Black-Scholes in Hamiltonian form, where ψ is the option price and x = log(S).

trading_applications: Exotic option pricing with path integrals

books.title: Quantum Computing: An Applied Approach
books.author: Jack Hidary
books.summary: Practical introduction to quantum computing with Python implementations using Qiskit and Cirq. Includes dedicated chapters on finance applications and optimization algorithms.
key_insights: QAOA can solve portfolio optimization as a QUBO (Quadratic Unconstrained Binary Optimization)
VQE is near-term viable for small optimization problems
Amplitude estimation provides quadratic speedup for Monte Carlo methods
Current NISQ devices can run meaningful finance experiments
Hybrid classical-quantum approaches are most practical today

formulas.name: QAOA Objective
formulas.explanation: Minimize expectation of cost Hamiltonian H_C over parameterized quantum state.

formulas.name: Amplitude Estimation Speedup
formulas.explanation: Quantum amplitude estimation achieves quadratic speedup in precision ε for Monte Carlo.

books.title: Quantum Machine Learning: What Quantum Computing Means to Data Mining
books.author: Peter Wittek
books.summary: Comprehensive treatment of quantum machine learning algorithms. Shows how quantum computers can achieve exponential speedups for certain ML tasks relevant to finance.
key_insights: Quantum SVM can operate in exponentially large feature spaces
Quantum PCA achieves exponential speedup for covariance matrix eigenvectors
Quantum sampling enables faster Boltzmann machine training
Many speedups depend on QRAM (quantum random access memory) which is hard to build
Near-term advantage comes from quantum kernel methods, not full quantum algorithms

formulas.name: Quantum Kernel
formulas.explanation: Kernel computed as overlap of quantum feature states, enabling high-dimensional feature maps.

books.title: An Introduction to Econophysics: Correlations and Complexity in Finance
books.author: Rosario Mantegna, H. Eugene Stanley
books.summary: Applies statistical physics methods to financial data analysis. Demonstrates that price returns follow Lévy distributions (not Gaussian), with power law tails critical for risk management.
key_insights: Price returns have fat tails described by power law P(x) ~ x^(-α) with α ≈ 3
Correlation matrices contain noise that can be filtered using random matrix theory
Market crashes exhibit scaling behavior similar to physical phase transitions
Volatility clustering follows long-memory processes
Standard deviation is NOT a good risk measure due to non-Gaussian returns

formulas.name: Lévy Stable Distribution
formulas.expression: P(x) ~ exp(-|x|^α/σ^α) for small x, P(x) ~ x^(-1-α) for large x
formulas.explanation: Price returns follow Lévy distribution with α ≈ 1.7, explaining fat tails.

formulas.name: Marchenko-Pastur Distribution
formulas.explanation: Eigenvalue distribution of random correlation matrices. Eigenvalues outside this are signal, not noise.

trading_applications: Better VaR models using power law tails

books.title: Theory of Financial Risk and Derivative Pricing
books.author: Jean-Philippe Bouchaud, Marc Potters
books.summary: Applies statistical physics to derivative pricing and risk management. Shows why Black-Scholes fails and provides physics-based corrections.
key_insights: Black-Scholes underprices tail risk by assuming Gaussian returns
Optimal hedging with realistic distributions differs significantly from delta hedging
Mean-variance optimization is highly unstable due to estimation error
Volatility smile emerges naturally from non-Gaussian distributions
Physics methods provide better handling of market crashes

formulas.name: Corrected Option Price
formulas.explanation: Black-Scholes plus kurtosis correction, where κ₄ is excess kurtosis of returns.

trading_applications: Improved option pricing with kurtosis corrections

books.title: Quantum Trading: Using Principles of Modern Physics to Forecast the Financial Markets
books.author: Fabio Oreste
books.summary: Applies quantum mechanics concepts metaphorically to market analysis. Less rigorous mathematically but provides intuitive framework for thinking about market uncertainty.
key_insights: Markets exist in superposition of bullish/bearish states until 'observed' (measured)
Uncertainty principle suggests limits to simultaneous price and momentum precision
Wave function collapse represents regime transitions
Quantum interference patterns appear in market cycles
Measurement (trading) affects the measured system
books.caution: More metaphorical than rigorous - useful for intuition but not direct implementation

books.title: Financial Modeling Using Quantum Computing
books.author: Anshul Saxena, Javier Mancilla
books.summary: Modern practical guide to implementing quantum finance algorithms using current frameworks. Heavy on code examples and real implementations.
key_insights: VQE is currently most practical algorithm for finance optimization
Quantum kernels provide advantage for fraud detection classification
Credit risk analysis benefits from amplitude estimation
Hybrid algorithms combine best of classical and quantum
IBM and Amazon cloud quantum computers are production-ready for experiments

books.title: Programming Quantum Computers
books.author: Eric Johnston, Nic Harrigan, Mercedes Gimeno-Segovia
books.summary: Hands-on programming guide using visual quantum circuit simulator. Excellent for building intuition through experimentation.
key_insights: QFT is foundation of many quantum speedups (applicable to signal processing)
Grover's algorithm provides sqrt(N) speedup for search (trade signal screening)
Phase estimation is key primitive for many finance algorithms
Current hardware requires significant error mitigation
Circuit depth is main limitation on NISQ devices

books.title: Quantum Computing Since Democritus
books.author: Scott Aaronson
books.summary: Deep theoretical exploration of what quantum computers can and cannot do. Critical for understanding realistic expectations.
key_insights: BQP (quantum complexity class) does NOT contain NP-complete problems
Quantum speedup is NOT exponential for all problems
Only specific problem structures benefit from quantum
Quantum supremacy demonstrations don't translate directly to useful speedups
Understanding limits prevents wasted effort on wrong problems
trading_applications: Identifying which trading problems CAN benefit from quantum
Avoiding hype about impossible quantum advantages

books.title: Interest Rates and Coupon Bonds in Quantum Finance
books.author: Belal E. Baaquie
books.summary: Advanced sequel applying quantum field theory specifically to interest rate markets. Reformulates HJM and LIBOR market models using path integrals.
key_insights: Forward rate curve can be modeled as a quantum field
Path integral approach naturally handles term structure dynamics
Provides analytical solutions where Monte Carlo traditionally required
Coupon bond pricing simplifies with quantum formalism
Connects directly to central bank policy modeling

reading_priority.reason: Core theory connecting quantum and finance
